tools.name: Replit
tools.description: Collaborative, browser-based coding platform supporting multiple programming languages. Includes hosting, built-in terminals, and real-time multiplayer editing.

tools.name: Gitpod
tools.description: Full dev environment in the browser that spins up on-demand workspaces integrated with GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket.

tools.name: CodeSandbox
tools.description: Browser-based environment for web app development, excellent for rapid prototyping in JavaScript frameworks like React, Vue, and Angular.

tools.name: Glitch
tools.description: Simple, user-friendly platform that lets you instantly create, edit, and deploy full-stack web apps from your browser.

tools.name: Figma
tools.description: Browser-based UI/UX design and prototyping tool. Allows real-time collaboration, vector editing, and rapid prototyping.

tools.name: Penpot
tools.description: Open-source design and prototyping platform that runs entirely in the browser. Great for wireframes and detailed UI design.

tools.name: Excalidraw
tools.description: Open-source virtual whiteboard for sketches, diagrams, and wireframes, with a hand-drawn style that?s great for brainstorming.

tools.name: Trello
tools.description: Kanban-style project management with boards, lists, and cards. Free version suitable for personal or small team use.

tools.name: Notion
tools.description: All-in-one workspace for notes, tasks, wikis, and databases. Highly flexible, with real-time collaboration in the browser.

tools.name: Taiga
tools.description: Open-source project management platform with Scrum and Kanban support. Offers a browser-accessible hosted version.

tools.name: Hugging Face
tools.description: Community-driven platform for machine learning models (NLP, vision, etc.). Host models, run inference, or try them via web demos.

tools.name: Kaggle
tools.description: Data science community providing free GPU/TPU notebooks, datasets, competitions, and hosted notebooks in your browser.

tools.name: Observable
tools.description: Browser-based data notebooks for interactive data visualization in JavaScript. Useful for real-time exploration and sharing.

tools.name: Zotero Web Library
tools.description: Open-source reference manager with cloud sync. Browser-based interface to organize citations, PDFs, and research materials.

tools.name: Etherpad
tools.description: Real-time collaborative text editing. Open-source solution that can be hosted or accessed on public instances via browser.

tools.name: Obsidian Publish
tools.description: While Obsidian is typically a desktop app, Obsidian Publish offers a browser-accessible way to share vault notes online. Good for hosting knowledge bases.

tools.name: GitLab (Online)
tools.description: Open-source DevOps platform. The GitLab.com instance allows free private repos, CI/CD pipelines, and issue tracking in the browser.

tools.name: SourceForge
tools.description: One of the oldest platforms for hosting open-source projects. Provides version control, downloads, and web-based administration.
